title: analytics/mediawiki/structured_task/article/image_suggestion_interaction
description: Analytics events for interactions with image suggestion structured task

$schema.description: A URI identifying the JSONSchema for this event. This should match an schema's $id in a schema repository. E.g. /schema/title/1.0.0

dt.description: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp of when the event occurred/was generated in UTC). This exists separately from meta.dt in the main common schema. For external client-sent instrumentation events, we want to allow meta.dt to be the received time (filled in by EventGate at ingest time), as we don't trust client-sent events to always set the proper date and time. Client-set event generation time should be set here instead. See: https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T240460

homepage_pageview_token.description: One-time token per page load generated on Special:Homepage. This is a random user session ID that will be exported to the client-side, so that this schema's events can be associated with HomepageModule and HomepageVisit schema events

client_ip.description: The http client's IP address, usually set from the X-Client-IP header, the value of which is extracted from X-Forwarded-For.

has_cookies.description: True if the http request has any cookies set

method.description: The HTTP request method (GET, POST, etc.)

protocol.description: The protocol used for the request (HTTP or HTTPS)

request_headers.description: Request headers sent by the client.  E.g. user-agent, etc.

response_headers.description: Response headers sent back to the client (when known).

status_code.description: The HTTP status code returned for this request (when known)

is_mobile.description: Whether the mobile site is being used.

domain.description: Domain the event or entity pertains to

dt.description: UTC event datetime, in ISO-8601 format

request_id.description: Unique ID of the request that caused the event

stream.description: Name of the stream/queue/dataset that this event belongs in

uri.description: Unique URI identifying the event or entity

newcomer_task_token.description: a value by which to join with the NewcomerTask event

page_id.description: ID of the page the user is attempting to edit.

page_title.description: Title of the article used for the task (in text form, with page prefix).

active_interface.description: Name of the currently open interface

action.description:
Action the user took link_click:
 - The user clicked on the "Learn more" link in onboarding_step_1_dialog
 - The user clicked on the link target in the recommendedimagetoolbar_dialog

action_data.description:
Additional data for certain actions For action=skip_all:
 - dont_show_again is true or false
For action=get_started:
 - dont_show_again is true or false
For action=next in onboarding_step_{1/2/3}_dialog:
 - dont_show_again is true or false
For action=back in onboarding_step_{1/2/3}_dialog:
 - dont_show_again is true or false
For action=link_click in the onboarding_step_1_dialog:
 - dont_show_again checkbox is true or false
For action=close on rejection_dialog:
 - rejection_reason The string for the ID of the reason for rejecting the recommendation.
For actions suggestion_accept, suggestion_reject, suggestion_skip, link_click, view_help on recommendedimagetoolbar_dialog:
 - filename The name of the suggested image
 - recommendation_source One of 'wikidata', 'wikipedia', 'commons'
 - recommendation_source_projects A list of wiki IDs. Only when recommendation_source is 'wikipedia'.
 - rejection_reason The rejection reason, if any
 - acceptance_state The acceptance state of the suggestion. One of "accepted", "rejected" or "undecided"
  For actions suggestion_accept, suggestion_reject, the above data, plus:
   - previous_acceptance_state The previous acceptance state of the suggestion. One of "accepted", "rejected" or "undecided"
For actions editmode_select and editmode_confirm_switch:
   - selected_mode is one of "visual", "machinesuggestions" or "source"
